availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: I James E. Temple a Commissioner appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky in and for the State of Tennessee resident at Memphis in pursuance of the act of the general Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky entitled an act to adopt the revised Statues approved January 7th 1852 for the State of Kentucky do solemnly swear that I will ^well^ and -- faithfully discharge all -- the duties appertaining to the said office of Commissioner -- according to the laws of the State of Kentucky so help me God

James E Temple
Commissioner for Kentucky
Sworn to and subscribed before me at Memphis this 16th April 1863

P. M. Dickinson J. P. S. C.
James E Temple

figure.ab:
JAMES E TEMPLE
COMMISSIONER FOR THE STATE OF Kentucky
MEMPHIS. TENN.

body.p:
Tennessee
Oath of office
Jas E. Temple
Memphis
Filed Apr 21st 1863.
